column3: $First game at Nationals Park; ceremonial pitch by President George Bush
$Hudson's throw went behind the runner and down the RF line
$Johnson's first game since 9/23/2006 when he broke his leg
$McCann hesitated after rounding the 1B bag
$Zimmerman allowed the ball to roll down the line and it struck the bag
Nationals Elijah Dukes left the game due to injured right hamstring
Debut game for Burke Badenhop
$Willingham climbed the wall in front of the bullpen to deflect the ball back onto the field; it would have been a homer otherwise
$91 minute rain delay before game
Braves pitcher Tom Glavine left the game due to an injured hamstring
$Lo Duca was hit on the right hand
$Johnson made a diving catch and slid on the warning track into the wall
$First career homer for Nieves
$catcher Nieves threw behind Cedeno at 2B but Cedeno broke for 3B and easily beat the relay throw; Blanco moved up on the play
$the ball bounced off Nick Johnson's glove; pitcher John Lannan did not cover 1B; Nick Johnson started to the bag once he picked up the ball but had no chance to beat Reed Johnson to the bag
25 minute delay due to a partial power failure; some of the field lights went off

$O'Connor was removed with a 2-0 count on Cantu; Hanrahan threw the wild pitch and then completed the walk; since O'Connor was charged with the walk according to the rules, Hanrahan threw a wild pitch to a batter he did not face
$bloop down the RF line that no one could get to
$liner off Myers's leg
$infield shifted to right for Howard
$infield shifted for Howard

$infield shifted for Howard
$Flores made a great block of the plate to get Dobbs
$the ball bounced into the batter's eye in CF
$infield shifted to right for Howard
$hit into the upper deck in right center field (section 242 row 2); this is the last section of seats in center field
$Dmitri Young misplayed the throw in from right field and the ball rolled past everyone at the plate and into the camera well on the home plate side of the visitor's dugout
$high bouncer over Condrey's head
$Felix and Rollins each expected the other to catch the ball and it dropped between them on the infield
$Dukes fouls a ball of his left leg
Nationals Elijah Dukes left the game due to a contusion on his left leg

$over the visitor bullpen

$the ball struck the facing of the upper deck (section 242)

$the ball struck just above the wall on the concrete barrier which is out of play; it was was initially ruled in play and Young made it to third; Nationals manager Manny Acta questioned the call, the umpires huddled, and the call was changed to a home run
$Perez fielded the come-backer and threw late to 2B; the ball was dropped by Lopez as he attempted to make the transfer to throw to 1B
$the ball hit the wet grass in front of Langerhans and skipped by him to the wall

$1B umpire Lance Barksdale ran into the outfield for any play on the fly ball; HP umpire Dana DeMuth ran towards 1B for a play there; Nationals pitcher Odalis Perez ran into DeMuth about 15 feet from the bag and DeMuth, while trying to avoid a collision, tumbled to the ground and did a barrel roll; his hat came off as he came up; he caught the hat and then made the call on Izturis for the double play
1:51 rain delay
Cardinals first baseman Albert Pujols left with a tight left calf
49 minute rain delay
Debut game for Mark Worrell
$the game ended at 12:19 after two rain delays totaling 2:40
$Glaus homered in both games of the double header
$Worrell homered on his first major league at bat
Giants center fielder Aaron Rowand left the game due to an injured leg
Debut game for Garrett Mock
$Young took the throw from RF on the edge of the infield dirt turned and saw Byrd halfway down the line; Young ran at Byrd, who never moved
$Dukes seemed to have trouble tracking the ball, which hit low on the out of town scoreboard and was catchable
Young rounded the bag too far and was not able to return
Rangers catcher Gerald Laird left the game due to a strained right hamstring
$the ball tipped off Wily Mo Pena's glove into the bullpen but appeared to be over the fence anyway
Debut game for Max Ramirez
$Birthday homer for Kinsler
$Birthday homer for Harris
Debut game for Steven Shell
$1:10 rain delay before start of game
$Milledge caught his foot under the padding on the outfield wall as he tried to field the ball; onto DL
Debut game for Roger Bernadina

ej,pereo001,P,herna901,Balk call $both balks were called by HP umpire Angel Hernandez; Odalis Perez stormed off the mound towards the plate and was ejected by Hernandez; after the game, Perez claimed that Hernandez has something against Perez

$Nationals first baseman Dmitri Young ran under the popup in foul territory and Diamondbacks batter/runner Conor Jackson ran around Young into fair territory; as Jackson passed, Young lunged into fair territory to catch the ball, running into Jackson; the ball struck Young's glove and both he and the ball hit the ground; Jackson was called out for interfering with Young
Astros pitcher Roy Oswalt left the game due to an injured leg
Nationals first baseman Dmitri Young left the game due to an injured back

Nationals first baseman Paul Lo Duca took the grounder and stepped on 1B; he looked towards 3B to keep Lance Berkman from scoring but never looked behind him, where Carlos Lee was standing with nowhere to go; Lee snuck back in while Lo Duca stood there, thus missing an easy double play
$the throw bounced about three feet in front of Lo Duca, who was unable to catch or block it; the ball went into the camera well at the end of the dugout
$Ronnie Belliard never had control of the throw from Felipe Lopez
$Very hard one-hopper that bounced off Eric Bruntlett towards Jimmy Rollins; Bruntlett picked it up and threw to Chase Utley, who tagged Ryan Zimmerman, who had rounded the bag too far
$Lo Duca misplayed the throw in from centerfield and it ended up at the Nationals dugout
Jenkins misplayed the ball in foul territory near the wall
$the hard grounder bounced off Zimmerman's glove; he picked it up and threw the ball into the runner
$Zimmerman was hit on the right hand
Nationals third baseman Ryan Zimmerman left the game due to an injured hand/wrist
$both sides warned by HP umpire Fieldin Culbreth
Nationals left fielder Elijah Dukes left the game with a leg cramp after hitting himself with the bat on his follow through
$the ball bounced past Adam Dunn
$the Nationals shifted the infield to the right each time Delgado batted
$the runner at second, Brian Schneider, blocked the view of SS Cristian Guzman and the hard grounder got past Guzman
Nationals center fielder Ryan Langerhans left the game due to an injured back
$the Nationals shifted the infield for each Delgado at bat
$fan interference
$Bonifacio was playing in shallow right field and threw the ball to the infield side of the bag for the error
$Rockies pitcher Livan Hernandez made a good block of the hard hit ball with his glove but could not make a play at any base once he retrieved the ball, which had bounced about 15 feet away
Rockies shortstop Troy Tulowitzki went to his left and the ball went past him on the right

$Aaron Cook's hard throw to second was wide to the right side and went past SS Troy Tulowitzki; second baseman Clint Barmes backed up the play, caught the throw and threw the ball the first to get Milledge
$the ball bounced on the track and into the visitor's bullpen

$3bman Zimmerman fielded ball at bag, stepped on 3rd for force out and threw home; throw was off line and catcher Flores fumbled it, but he recovered and tagged the plate, thinking the force was still on; Garciaparra was not tagged but was called out by HP umpire Wegner; LA manager Torre came out to object but 3b ump Holbrook immediately informed Wegner that Garciaparra was not forced; Call was reversed and Garciaparra scored
$off the facing of the second deck

$Greg Maddux turned and fired the ball to 2B but the ball sailed wide; however, second baseman Jeff Kent was backing up the play, caught the ball and threw to first too late to get batter Lastings Milledge; Maddux would have had an easy play at first or home on the play but opted to attempt the double play to get out of the inning
$the ball caromed off pitcher Tim Redding to the right of first baseman Ronnie Belliard
$Lastings Milledge was running on the pitch and sailed into third; Greg Maddux ran to cover third but arrived a little late, catching the ball and diving towards Milledge as he slid in

$a soft grounder down the third base line fielded by Greg Maddux, who faked a throw to first, turned and caught Lastings Milledge off the bag; Milledge seemed to be heading home as Maddux was going to throw to first
$Cristian Guzman hit for the cycle; the first cycle at Nationals Park and the second by a Washington National player (Brad Wilkerson 4/6/2005)
$Nationals pitcher Odalis Perez failed to cover first on the grounder behind the bag
$Belliard's liner would have been a hit if the outfield had been at normal depth
$Chase Utley crashed into catcher Jesus Flores, who left the game with a sprained ankle

Debut game for Greg Golson

$Tatis dove for Perez's double and separated right shoulder, out for rest of season
